Description: Ear-ring, now corroded, comprises a simple copper alloy penannular hoop with overlapping ends and a pendant rod terminating in loops at both ends. The pendant, threaded with one rectangular copper alloy and two globular glazed composition beads, is suspended directly from the hoop.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: John de Monins Johnson
Curator's comments: Cf., EA 53931. For parallels in precious materials, cf., Stolz 2007, nos 19–25, Walker 2000, nos 107 and 108; Marshall 1969, no. 2588. For pendant rods, see Petrie 1927, nos 217, 218. Marshall, F. H. 1969. Catalogue of the jewellery: Greek, Etruscan, and Roman in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. London: The Trustees of the British Museum. Petrie, W. M. F. 1927. Objects of daily use. BSAE 42. London: Quaritch. Stolz, Y. 2007. Byzantine jewellery and related small finds from the underwater excavations in the Bay of Abuqir in Egypt: Their typology, production and context. Unpublished PhD diss. Oxford University. Walker, S. 2000. Ancient faces: Mummy portraits from Roman Egypt. New York: Metropolitan Museum of Art.
Bibliographic references: O'Connell et al 2014 / Antinoupolis at the British Museum (32)
